intro: Leptorkis welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's kis, is a rare and unique plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and small, waxy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. The plant produces striking yellow flowers during the rainy season, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in extreme conditions with minimal rainfall. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is often protected in its natural habitat.
